page.title: 03The River Avon cont.
page.content: Locally, the depth of the river varies greatly. The water is only one foot deep at Breamore Shallows. At Sandy Balls Strait it is 24ft. There are depth gauges to record the rise and fall of the river. At Burgate Manor Farm, until about five years ago, there were a lot of water meadows. During the winter, the hatches were regulated to allow the river to flood for several days. This ensured a plentiful supply of grass in the Spring. These meadows have now been drained and cultivated. One interesting thing about the river at Fordingbridge is that, owing to the underground streams from the chalklands coming out on the gravels, it is one of the five rivers in the world to freeze at the bottom first.
